net.sourceforge.cilib.Container.Tree
Class BinaryTree

java.lang.Object
  net.sourceforge.cilib.Container.Tree.BinaryTree
All Implemented Interfaces:
Tree
public class BinaryTree
extends java.lang.Object
implements Tree

This class provides a very simple BinaryTree implementation.

Author:
gpampara

Method Detail

add

public void add(BinaryTree b,
                int position)
Add a given BinaryTree to the current BinaryTree as a subtree, and add the subtree in the given position

Parameters:
b - The BinaryTree to add to the current node
position - The index where to add the subtree - this can only be BinaryTree.LEFT or BinaryTree.RIGHT

Get a referance to the subtree located in the position given

Specified by:
getSubtree in interface Tree

subtree - The position of the subtree to get a reference to
Returns:

public void addLeftSubtree(BinaryTree b)
Add a BinaryTree to the current BinaryTree as a subtree and place it in the "left" subtree position

Parameters:
b - The BinaryTree to add to the current BinaryTree node in the "left" position

removeSubtree

public Tree removeSubtree(int position)
Remove the subtree currently located in the BinaryTree at the given index / position

Parameters:
position - The location of the subtree in regards to the current BinaryTree
Returns:
The BinaryTree located at the given index / position or null if it is not found

removeLeftSubtree

public Tree removeLeftSubtree()
Remove the left subtree of the current BinaryTree

Returns:
The BinaryTree that was located in the left branch of the BinaryTree

removeRightSubtree

public Tree removeRightSubtree()
Remove the right subtree of the current BinaryTree

Returns:
The BinaryTree that was located in the right branch of the BinaryTree

isLeafNode

public boolean isLeafNode()
Determine if this BinaryTree node is a leaf node. This only happens if the node has no subtrees and the subtree links have null values.

Specified by:
isLeafNode in interface Tree
Returns:
True if the node is a leaf node, otherwise returns false
See Also:
Tree.isLeafNode()

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
This method determines if the Object contained by this BinaryTree is null or not. If it is null the Tree is empty with respect to node value.

Specified by:
isEmpty in interface Tree
Returns:
true - if the Tree node does not contain an object
See Also:
Tree.isEmpty()

accept

public void accept(Visitor v)
Accept a visitor into the Binary and base on the needs of the Visitor, the BinaryTree will be traversed.

Specified by:
accept in interface Tree
Parameters:
v - The Visitor to be used inside the BinaryTree
See Also:
Tree.accept(net.sourceforge.cilib.Container.Visitor)

getDegree

public int getDegree()
Get the current capacity of the BinaryTree. The degree is the amount of subtrees that have been filled out of the 2 possible.

Specified by:
getDegree in interface Tree
Returns:
The number of subtree elements that have been filled in the BinaryTree
See Also:
Tree.getDegree()
